page.title: 09THE CHURCH IN THE COMMUNITY
page.content: SANDHURST PARISH TO BE LOST The congregation at St.Lawrence's, Sandhurst, is 35 - 40 people for the one or two services each Sunday. All the school children go to Sunday School regularly. In a small community a higher proport- ion of people go to church than in the city. The vicar is able to know them all and the church plays an important role in village life. Sandhurst and five adjacent parishes are being reorganised and will soon be under one vicar. The present vicar, Mr McKinley, is only temporary until 1986. When the parishes are combined a lot of this personal contact will be lost. Sandhurst also had a Methodist Chapel but this is now being converted into a house. A similar chapel is to be found near Hartpury though this one, with its cemetery, is still in use.
